description: From Latin festula (“stalk, straw”). Compare fescue. The chemical is called "festucine" because it is found in Festuca.

adjectives.description: festucine (comparative more festucine, superlative most festucine)

examples: For here the true Cicada is not bred, but certain it is, that out of this, some kind of Locuſt doth proceed, for herein may be diſcovered a little inſect of a feſtucine or pale green, reſembling in all parts a Locuſt, or what we call a Graſhopper.

entries.meaning: (organic chemistry) Loline, an alkaloid with the formula C₈H₁₄N₂O.
